document_data.name: Sarkul
document_data.mainbody: '''Sarkul''' was a type of a variety of [[smoked fish]] and one of the most favorite [[Tantran]] foods in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2004)/General Facts on Tantras}}
document_data.Description: Sarkul was made using the [[fish]] from the [[Dragon Reach]]. The catch was beheaded, cleaned, gutted, and drenched in [[honey]] and local seasonings, before being hanged and smoked. The process of smoking took several days. The fish was cooked in enclosed smokehouses. The result was a savory food. Sarkul was never used as a filling for Tantran [[baeranth]] pies.
